previous_statement: As we continue to follow this breaking news story, there's another breaking news story that we've been following all morning and that is the shooting -- the shooting death of five individuals in the Maryland suburb of Washington. statement: <WELL>, I wanted to tell you that just moments ago, some police cars went screaming past us with their sirens going. We see that a helicopter is hovering overhead. We have no idea how significant that is, if it's even connected to the incidents that have happened out here and of course, we'll keep you updated on that as soon as we know more. But in any case, that just occurred moments ago with no information <ABOUT> why they were tearing down, heading in that direction. What we do know now is that police have just held a news conference, spent time talking <ABOUT> the fact that the massive search in this area involved a variety of secret service, FBI, county police departments, including, of course, Montgomery County here, the Washington D.C. police departments, the Maryland state police, all looking for those people or person involved in five shootings that the police <<<BELIEVE>>> were random shootings that occurred last night. The first one at 5:20 p.m. Nobody was hit in that particular one, but the police say was involved. Starting <ABOUT> 40 minutes later, another shooting in which somebody was shot and killed. And these are shootings that have occurred this morning, one of them occurred right in back of me at this gas station, where a taxicab driver was filling his car when he was shot and killed. Another one occurred at a Shell station -- this was a Mobil station in back of me -- at a Shell station further down the road, where a woman was vacuuming her car when she was shot and killed. Police are <<KIND OF>> coy <ABOUT> the witnesses possibility, but one witness, they said, discussed the possibility that the car that the shooters were using, and I say shooters for this reason: <MAY> have had two occupants. Police are not <<SURE>> of that. They also say that one witness said there was some <<SORT OF>> black lettering on the side of a vehicle, a box type van that had a broken tailgate. All of this <<KIND OF>> flimsy information right now, but the police are flooding the area. Now, schools in Montgomery County, which is a suburban county north of Washington -- schools in Montgomery County and D.C. are shut down to the point that the students who are there are being kept inside, no recess or anything like that for obvious reasons. The police said that they are working on plans now to close the schools, that at each of the schools that's affected, there will be a patrol car, police patrol on the scene to make <<SURE>> that the children are safe. Of course, one of the big things they've been trying to do out here is to make <<SURE>> the parents who <WOULD>, for good reason, be worried, don't worry. They say that the people whoa re in the schools, the children who are in the schools are as safe as can be. But there is going to be a police presence at both the schools. There has not been a shooting incident since <ABOUT> 10:00 this morning. Police, of course, have this massive search that's going on, helicopters, a variety of agencies from <AROUND> the area and as I just said, police cars went screaming to a location that way and there are some helicopters in the area. Don't know at this point if it has any consequence. Obviously, we'll keep you apprised, Kyra.

previous_statement: Well, it's funny you mentioned the Grammys, because the thing that I immediately thought of was the Canadian cultural content regulations that they have up north. Where in order to get played on Canadian radio your pop song has to be sufficiently Canadian. I believe it's something like half or two-thirds of all of the songs that get played on Canadian radio have to be considered Canadian cultural content. And if I remember it correctly, it's the singer, the songwriter and the producer. Two of the three have to be Canadians. And this, of course, has created a big boom in Canadian producers. So it's the similar thing, where you think it's going to be very visible, kind of on-screen ways and it's going to work also for behind the screens more. And I don't see any reason why it couldn't work for those -- the only reason it's expected not to work for the Grammys is the Grammys has less of an effect on the music market than the Oscars do on the film market. So, what the president is basically saying, "If in 90 days we haven`t seen progress, we`re going to put this issue back on the table," and he`s basically saying, "If the Mexican Congress weren`t to ratify this, then I again will use the issue of tariffs."

And it is now potentially reasonable that he`s got to shoot because he`s afraid, one against four. So it`s a big goof (ph).
